history.proof: intros n m H. unfold le_bool in H. destruct n as [| n']. - apply Nat.le_0_l. - destruct m as [| m']. + discriminate. + apply leb_complete. apply H.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall n m : nat, le_bool n m = true -> n <= m

Premises:
le_bool = fix le_bool (n m : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => true | S n1 => match m with | 0 => false | S m1 => le_bool n1 m1 end end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments le_bool (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Nat.le_antisymm : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> m <= n -> n = m
leb_complete : forall m n : nat, (m <=? n) = true -> m <= n
Nat.leb_le : forall n m : nat, (n <=? m) = true < -> n <= m
Nat.le_ngt : forall n m : nat, n <= m < -> ~ m < n
Nat.log2_bits_unique : forall a n : nat, Nat.testbit a n = true -> (forall m : nat, n < m -> Nat.testbit a m = false) -> Nat.log2 a = n
beq_nat_eq : forall n m : nat, true = (n =? m) -> n = m
beq_nat_true : forall n m : nat, (n =? m) = true -> n = m
Nat.eqb_eq : forall n m : nat, (n =? m) = true < -> n = m
VectorEq.eqb : forall A : Type, (A -> A -> bool) -> forall m n : nat, VectorDef.t A m -> VectorDef.t A n -> bool
BinInt.Z.log2_bits_unique : forall a n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.testbit a n = true -> (forall m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n m -> BinInt.Z.testbit a m = false) -> BinInt.Z.log2 a = n
BinInt.Z.le_antisymm : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m -> BinInt.Z.le m n -> n = m
BinNat.N.eqb_eq : forall n m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.eqb n m = true < -> n = m
Record SOR (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_SOR_theory { SORsetoid : Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req; SORplus_wd : forall x1 x2 : R, req x1 x2 -> forall y1 y2 : R, req y1 y2 ->...-> rlt rO (rtimes n m); SORneq_0_1 : ~ req rO rI } Arguments OrderedRing.SOR [R]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments OrderedRing.mk_SOR_theory [R]%type_scope [rO rI] [rplus rtimes rminus ropp req]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope _ (_ _ _ _ _)%function_scope _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope
BinInt.Z.lt_trichotomy : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n m \/ n = m \/ BinInt.Z.lt m n
BinInt.Z.le_gt_cases : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m \/ BinInt.Z.lt m n
BinInt.Z.le_ngt : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m < -> ~ BinInt.Z.lt m n
nat_morph_N = {| Smorph0 := eq_refl; Smorph1 := eq_refl; Smorph_add := Nnat.N2Nat.inj_add; Smorph_mul := Nnat.N2Nat.inj_mul; Smorph_eq := fun (x y : BinNums.N) (H : BinNat.N.eqb x y = true) => let H0 : forall n m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.eqb n m = true -> n = m := fun n m : BinNums.N => match BinNat.N.eqb_eq n m with | conj x0 _ => x0 end in let H1 : x = y := H0 x y H in eq_ind_r (fun x0 : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.to_nat x0 = BinNat.N.to_nat y) eq_refl H1 |} : semi_morph 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul eq BinNums.N0 (BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH) BinNat.N.add BinNat.N.mul BinNat.N.eqb BinNat.N.to_nat
BinInt.Z.lt_succ_r : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n (BinInt.Z.succ m) < -> BinInt.Z.le n m
Fin.eqb_nat_eq : forall (m n : nat) (p : Fin.t m) (q : Fin.t n), Fin.eqb p q = true -> m = n
Fin.eqb = fix eqb (m n : nat) (p : Fin.t m) (q : Fin.t n) {struct p} : bool := match p with | @Fin.F1 m' => match q with | @Fin.F1 n' => m' =? n' | Fin.FS _ => false end | @Fin.FS n0 p' => match q with | Fin.F1 => false | @Fin.FS n1 q' => eqb n0 n1 p' q' end end : forall m n : nat, Fin.t m -> Fin.t n -> bool Arguments Fin.eqb {m n}%nat_scope
VectorEq.eqb_nat_eq : forall (A : Type) (A_beq : A -> A -> bool) (m n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t A m) (v2 : VectorDef.t A n), VectorEq.eqb A A_beq v1 v2 = true -> m = n
BinNatDef.N.add = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => m | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => n | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.add p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.add (_ _)%N_scope
BinIntDef.Z.sub = fun m n : BinNums.Z => BinIntDef.Z.add m (BinIntDef.Z.opp n) : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.sub (_ _)%Z_scope
ZMicromega.Zsor = {| OrderedRing.SORsetoid := Zsth; OrderedRing.SORplus_wd := fun (x1 x2 : BinNums.Z) (H : x1 = x2) (y1 y2 : BinNums.Z) (H0 : y1 = y2) => eq_ind_r (fun x3 : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.add x3 y1 = BinInt.Z.add x2 y2) (eq_ind_r (fun y3 : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.add x2 y3 = BinInt.Z.add x2 y2) eq_refl H0) H; OrderedRing.SORtimes_wd := fun (x1 x2 : BinNums.Z) (H : x1 = x2) (y1 y2 : BinNums.Z) (H0 : y1 = y2) => eq_ind_r (fun x3 : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.mul x3 y1 = BinInt.Z.mul x2 y2) (eq_ind_r (fun y3 : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.mul x2 y3...
BinNatDef.N.eqb = fix eqb (n m : BinNums.N) {struct n} : bool := match n with | BinNums.N0 => match m with | BinNums.N0 => true | BinNums.Npos _ => false end | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => false | BinNums.Npos q => BinPos.Pos.eqb p q end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> bool Arguments BinNatDef.N.eqb (_ _)%N_scope
BinNatDef.N.mul = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.mul p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
BinInt.Z.bits_iff_neg_ex : forall a : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt a BinNums.Z0 < -> (exists k : BinNums.Z, forall m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt k m -> BinInt.Z.testbit a m = true)
Fin.t_ind : forall P : forall n : nat, Fin.t n -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P (S n) Fin.F1) -> (forall (n : nat) (t : Fin.t n), P n t -> P (S n) (Fin.FS t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : Fin.t n), P n t
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, Fin.t (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, Fin.t n -> Fin.t (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
VectorDef.cons : forall A : Type, A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n)
Nat.bits_above_log2 : forall a n : nat, Nat.log2 a < n -> Nat.testbit a n = false
VectorDef.t_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> Prop), P 0 (VectorDef.nil A) -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t A n), P n t -> P (S n) (VectorDef.cons A h n t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t A n), P n t
VectorDef.rect2 : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> VectorDef.t ?B n -> Type, P 0 (VectorDef.nil ?A) (VectorDef.nil ?B) -> (forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 -> forall (a : ?A) (b : ?B), P (S n) (VectorDef.cons ?A a n v1) (VectorDef.cons ?B b n v2)) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 where ?A : [ |- Type] ?B : [ |- Type]
Nat.eq_0_gt_0_cases : forall n : nat, n = 0 \/ 0 < n
Nat.bits_0 : forall n : nat, Nat.testbit 0 n = false
Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : VectorDef.t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n) Arguments VectorDef.t _%type_scope _%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.nil _%type_scope Arguments VectorDef.cons _%type_scope _ _%nat_scope
BinInt.Z.bits_above_log2 : forall a n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 a -> BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.log2 a) n -> BinInt.Z.testbit a n = false
Nat.bit_log2 : forall a : nat, a <> 0 -> Nat.testbit a (Nat.log2 a) = true
bool_ring_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list bool) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist false true xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N true andb) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval false true xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N true andb) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval false true xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N true andb) l pe2
BinInt.Z.lt_succ_diag_r : forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n (BinInt.Z.succ n)

``` 
intros n m H.
unfold le_bool in H.
destruct n as [| n'].
- intro.
  apply Nat.le_0_l.
- destruct m as [| m'].
  + intro.
    discriminate.
  + apply leb_complete.
    exact H.
```

original: intros n m H. unfold le_bool in H. destruct n as [| n']. - intro. apply Nat.le_0_l. - destruct m as [| m']. + intro. discriminate. + apply leb_complete. apply H.
